oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Improving “Low Input” Sheep Production Systems in Europe
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hoste, Hervé
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Breeding and genetics
Sheep and goats
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sheep production in EU represents more than 100 millions heads which are mainly found in less favoured areas throughout Europe. Small ruminants are usually kept in geographical areas where other livestock or crop industries are difficult to implement.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hoste, Hervé (2011) Improving “Low Input” Sheep Production Systems in Europe. Paper at: First LowInputBreeds Symposium on Ethical Consideration in Livestock Breeding, Wagningen, The Netherlands, March 15 and 16, 2011. [Completed]
